body_html:
Looks like I accidentally installed cudnn 6.0 side by side with 5.1 while attempting to fix the issue. This is not the cause of the problem though, as I was on a working setup with just cudnn 5.1 prior to upgrading to 1.0.1

Invoking session.run() produces the following log output: https://gist.github.com/bicubic/c3edcc0b311437dd6888edc4bac30315

Device mapping: no known devices. sounds ominous.

This is based on the gpu example which explicitly assigns the job to gpu0 which was working recently on 0.12. The example still seems to run fine, just not being executed on the gpu.

body:
Looks like I accidentally installed cudnn 6.0 side by side with 5.1 while attempting to fix the issue. This is not the cause of the problem though, as I was on a working setup with just cudnn 5.1 prior to upgrading to 1.0.1

Invoking session.run() produces the following log output: https://gist.github.com/bicubic/c3edcc0b311437dd6888edc4bac30315

`Device mapping: no known devices.` sounds ominous. 

This is based on the gpu example which explicitly assigns the job to gpu0 which was working recently on 0.12. The example still seems to run fine, just not being executed on the gpu.
